meanings.definition: To look fixedly or vacantly at someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She would stare at the stars every night before bed.
meanings.sent2: The cat would stare at the mouse intently.
meanings.sent3: The painting seemed to stare back at the curious onlookers.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to stare into the depths of her soul.
meanings.sent5: The eerie statue's eyes appeared to stare right through you.

meanings.sent1: His stare made her feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The intense stare from across the room was unsettling.
meanings.sent3: The cat's stare at the bird was comical as it tried to sneak closer.
meanings.sent4: The stare of the old tree in the forest seemed to hold ancient wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The piercing stare of the hawk searching for its prey was mesmerizing.
